summary: This is an email from Captain Tova Noel of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, sent on August 14, 2019, reporting that she had contact with Officer Noel at 2:15 PM and that Officer Noel was in good spirits. The email appears to be a routine status update or 'watch call' regarding staff welfare.

persons.name: Tova Noel
persons.context: The sender of the email, reporting on contact with another officer. She identifies herself as the Captain of the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York.

persons.name: Officer Noel
persons.context: The subject of the email. Captain Tova Noel reports having contact with her at 2:15 PM on August 14, 2019, and that she was in good spirits.

connections.description: Captain Tova Noel is reporting on the status and welfare of Officer Noel, indicating a professional supervisory relationship within the correctional facility.

events.title: Status check on Officer Noel
events.description: Captain Tova Noel reports making contact with Officer Noel at 2:15 PM and finding her in good spirits.

locations.address: Metropolitan Correctional Center, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007

keyFacts: The email is dated August 14, 2019, which is the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at the Metropolitan Correctional Center on August 10, 2019.
The correspondence is a routine welfare check ('watch call') between staff members at the MCC, specifically involving Captain Tova Noel and Officer Noel.
The document originates from the MCC, the facility where Jeffrey Epstein was held and died, during the immediate aftermath of his death.
